SENT.plain: Lacunar infarcts (LACs) and deep intracerebral hemorrhages (DICHs) occur in the same structures and may result from the same pathology
It is unclear why one patient has an LAC while another has DICH
We compared LAC to DICH cases derived from a population-based incidence study
In multivariate analysis, LAC cases were significantly older, more likely to have diabetes, and had higher cholesterol than DICH cases
